Fix Floating Point Precision in JavaScript
entry.content:
toPrecision is a JavaScript built-in function which can be used to set precision of a floating number, example usage:

var number = 123.456789;
number.toPrecision(5); // returns string: '123.46'

To convert string to number use:

Number(number.toPrecision(5));

entry.title: How to Get List of Files Inside a Tar Archive in Linux
entry.content:
Get the list of files inside a tar archive in Linux using command line tar command:

tar --list -f archive.tar.gz

entry.title: Search and Replace Commands in Linux
entry.content:
Sed command does a great job for search and replace, let’s see an example:

sed -i -- 's/foo/bar/g' myfile.txt

This will convert the string “foo” to “bar” in myfile.txt, if you would like to perform this on all files use:

sed -i -- 's/foo/bar/g' *

The same can be done recursively using find command:

find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/foo/bar/g' {} +

entry.title: Sprintf Equivalent in Javascript
entry.content:
Below are the two methods by which we can emulate sprintf in Javascript directly to console.log and String.format:

console.log approach:

(function() {

    var logger = console.log;

    console.log = function() {

        var format = function(str, args) {
            logger(args);
            return str.replace(/{(\d+)}/g, function(match, number) {
                return typeof args[number] != 'undefined' ? args[number] : match;
            });
        };
        var inputs = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments);
        logger(format(inputs.shift(), inputs));
    }

})()

console.log("Hello {1}", 10, 100);</pre>
<p></p>


String.format approach:

entry.title: How to Trigger Event on Pressing Enter Key in AngularJS
entry.content:
Use the below directive which triggers a function when enter / return key is pressed:

.directive('ngEnter', function () {
    return function (scope, element, attrs) {
        element.bind("keydown keypress", function (event) {
            if (event.which === 13) {
                scope.$apply(function () {
                    scope.$eval(attrs.ngEnter);
                });
                event.preventDefault();
            }
        });
    };
});

Usage:

<input ng-model="input" ng-enter="enterTriggered">

entry.title: How Emit a Event When Ng-repeat Is Completed AngularJS
entry.content:
Use a directive with ng-repeat which triggers a function when ng-repeat reaches to last element, directive code:

.directive('onFinishEmit', function($timeout) {
    return {
        restrict: 'A',       
        link: function(scope, element, attr) {
            if (scope.$last === true) {
                $timeout(function() {                        
                    scope.$emit(attr.onFinishEmit);
                });
            }
        }
    }
});

Usage:

<div ng-repeat="data in dataset" on-finish-emit="renderComplete">

</div>

entry.title: How to Read Process Output in Powershell
entry.content:
If you are running a process via powershell you can capture the stdout and stderr using StandardOutput.ReadToEnd() and StandardError.ReadToEnd(), below is the example:

$pinfo = New-Object System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo
$pinfo.FileName = "ping.exe"
$pinfo.RedirectStandardError = $true
$pinfo.RedirectStandardOutput = $true
$pinfo.UseShellExecute = $false
$pinfo.Arguments = "localhost"
$p = New-Object System.Diagnostics.Process
$p.StartInfo = $pinfo
$p.Start() | Out-Null
$p.WaitForExit()
$stdout = $p.StandardOutput.ReadToEnd()
$stderr = $p.StandardError.ReadToEnd()
Write-Host "stdout: $stdout"
Write-Host "stderr: $stderr"
Write-Host "exit code: " + $p.ExitCode

entry.title: Convert CR2 to JPG in Ubuntu
entry.content:
Convert cr2 to jpeg files in Ubuntu in a few simple steps:

Step 1: Install ufraw

sudo apt-get install ufraw

Step 2: For ufraw

for i in *.CR2; do ufraw-batch $i --out-type=jpeg --output $i.jpg; done;

This will convert all cr2 files a directory into jpeg files, later if you don’t want cr2 files use rm -f *.cr2
